title: Barcelona consider Florian Thauvin move after former Newcastle flop is called up to France squad following impressive Marseille performances
text:
Comments BARCELONA are mulling a summer transfer move that will baffle Newcastle fans. 
According to Mundo Deportivo , the Catalans are considering signing former Toon flop Florian Thauvin to play on the right of midfield. AP:Associated Press 5 Florian Thauvin has been rejuvenated since joining Marseille 
Thauvin has been rejuvenated since returning to Marseille and was called up to Didier Deschamps’ France squad for this week’s round of international fixtures. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest Football news, gossip and rumours 
And the Catalans are believed to be impressed after he picked up an incredible five of the last eight club player of the month awards. 
The right side of midfield has been a problem position for Barcelona all season, with Rafinha, Sergi Roberto and Denis Suarez all failing to nail down a place in the team. Barcelona are well-connected at Marseille with former sporting director Andoni Zubizarreta now in the same role at the French club. 
During his six months at Newcastle , Thauvin was more famous for his dress sense than his football. Getty Images His form has earned him a France call-up and five of the last eight Marseille player of the month awards Getty Images Thauvin flopped at Newcastle and infuriated fans by turning up to a match in a tuxedo AP:Associated Press Barcelona are looking for a new right midfielder Getty Images 5 Monaco’s Djibril Sidibe is also a potential target 
After a 2-1 defeat at home to Watford he was slated by club legend Alan Shearer for turning up in a tuxedo. 
But the Frenchman later argued he was unfairly singled out by the former Magpies striker. 
He told L’Equipe: “In England, at each home game, you need to come to the stadium in a suit. It is the tradition. Monaco forward Kylian Mbappe sings in front of new France team-mates 
"But on that day, Alan Shearer violently criticised me by saying that I was making myself out to be someone that I wasn't, even though I was not the only one wearing a bowtie. 
"Why me again? I would like to be left alone." 
Barcelona are also looking at fellow Frenchman Djibril Sidibe, who made a decisive contribution for Les Bleus last night, but not one that will impress the neutrals. 
The Monaco star threw himself to the ground to earn a penalty, which was converted by Antoine Griezmann on the way to a 3-1 French win in Luxembourg.
